Sample.Title: smRNA-Seq analysis of H1EScd1, HS1295-1_42ERCAAXX

Channel.Source: smRNA-Seq analysis of H1EScd1
Channel.Characteristics: Total RNA was extracted using Trizol from Invitrogen as per manufacturer's instuctions.

The small RNA fraction was separated by electrophoresis on a Novex 10% TBE-Urea gel and the fraction between approximately 14-30nt was excised. The excisd fraction was then eluted from gel fragements, followed by EtOH precipitation and was resuspended in 6.3ul.

3' RNA adapter ligation was set up with 6.3ul of purified 5' ligation product, 1.2ul of 10uM 3' RNA adapter, 1ul of 10x Ligation buffer, 1ul of T4 RNA Ligase (5U/ul from Ambion)), and 0.5ul of Rnase OUT (40U/ul from Invitrogen). The ligation reaction was incubated at 16oC overnight.

5' RNA adapter ligation was set up with 6.2ul of purified small RNA fraction (14-30nt), 1.3ul of 5uM 5' RNA adapter, 1ul of 10x Ligation buffer, 1ul of T4 RNA Ligase (5U/ul from Ambion), and 0.5ul of Rnase OUT (40U/ul from Invitrogen). Ligation reaction was incubated at 16oC overnight.

To 4.5ul of purified ligated RNA, 0.5ul of 100uM Small RNA RT-Primer was added and heat denatured at 70oC for 2 mins. Sample was then placed on a rack at room temperature and the following reagents were added immediately to the sample (2.0ul of 5X First Strand Buffer, 0.65ul of 10mM dNTPs (Invitrogen), 1ul of 100mM DTT (Invitrogen) and 0.5ul of RNaseOUT (40U/ul from Invitrogen). Reaction was heated at 48oC for 3mins. 1.0ul of Superscript II RT (200U/ul from Invitrogen) was added to the reaction and was incubated at 44oC for 1 hr. After 1hr of incubation, tube was placed on ice. 12ul of DEPC water was added to the first strand cDNA product to make a final total volume of approximately 20ul.
10ul of the first strand cDNA product was used in the PCR
98oC for 30sec; 98oC for 10sec, 60oC for 30sec, 72oC for 15sec for 15 cycles; 72oC for 5min
PCR product was separated by electrophoresis on 8% TBE Novex Gel and the PCR product between 92-125bp was excised. Product was then eluted from gel fragements, followed by EtOH precipitation
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Library construction protocol: NA

Sample.Title: smRNA-Seq analysis of HS1740; HS1740-1_430N8AAXX

Channel.Source: Breast vHMEC Rep2; HS1740-1_430N8AAXX
Channel.Characteristics: Tlsty Lab, University of California, San Francisco
Total RNA was extracted using Trizol from Invitrogen as per manufacturer's instuctions.

The small RNA fraction was separated by electrophoresis on a Novex 10% TBE-Urea gel and the fraction between approximately 14-30nt was excised. The excisd fraction was then eluted from gel fragements, followed by EtOH precipitation and was resuspended in 6.3ul.

3' RNA adapter ligation was set up with 6.3ul of purified 5' ligation product, 1.2ul of 10uM 3' RNA adapter, 1ul of 10x Ligation buffer, 1ul of T4 RNA Ligase (5U/ul from Ambion)), and 0.5ul of Rnase OUT (40U/ul from Invitrogen). The ligation reaction was incubated at 16oC overnight.

5' RNA adapter ligation was set up with 6.2ul of purified small RNA fraction (14-30nt), 1.3ul of 5uM 5' RNA adapter, 1ul of 10x Ligation buffer, 1ul of T4 RNA Ligase (5U/ul from Ambion), and 0.5ul of Rnase OUT (40U/ul from Invitrogen). Ligation reaction was incubated at 16oC overnight.

To 4.5ul of purified ligated RNA, 0.5ul of 100uM Small RNA RT-Primer was added and heat denatured at 70oC for 2 mins. Sample was then placed on a rack at room temperature and the following reagents were added immediately to the sample (2.0ul of 5X First Strand Buffer, 0.65ul of 10mM dNTPs (Invitrogen), 1ul of 100mM DTT (Invitrogen) and 0.5ul of RNaseOUT (40U/ul from Invitrogen). Reaction was heated at 48oC for 3mins. 1.0ul of Superscript II RT (200U/ul from Invitrogen) was added to the reaction and was incubated at 44oC for 1 hr. After 1hr of incubation, tube was placed on ice. 12ul of DEPC water was added to the first strand cDNA product to make a final total volume of approximately 20ul.
10ul of the first strand cDNA product was used in the PCR
98oC for 30sec; 98oC for 10sec, 60oC for 30sec, 72oC for 15sec for 15 cycles; 72oC for 5min
PCR product was separated by electrophoresis on 8% TBE Novex Gel and the PCR product between 92-125bp was excised. Product was then eluted from gel fragements, followed by EtOH precipitation
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Library construction protocol: NA

Sample.Title: RNA-seq (polyA+) Breast vHMEC; HS2263-1_620G6AAXX

Channel.Source: Breast, vHMEC, RM035; HS2263-1_620G6AAXX
Channel.Characteristics: Tlsty Lab, University of California, San Francisco
98C 30 sec, 10 cycle of 98C 10 sec, 65C 30 sec, 72C 30 sec, then 72C 5 min, 4C hold
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Library construction protocol: PolyA+ RNA was purified using the MACS mRNA isolation kit (Miltenyi Biotec, Bergisch Gladbach, Germany), from 5-10ug of DNaseI-treated total RNA as per the manufacturer's instructions. Double-stranded cDNA was synthesized from the purified polyA+ RNA using the Superscript Double-Stranded cDNA Synthesis kit (Invitrogen, Carlsbad, CA, USA) and random hexamer primers (Invitrogen) at a concentration of 5M. The cDNA was fragmented by sonication and a paired-end sequencing library prepared following the Illumina paired-end library preparation protocol (Illumina, Hayward, CA, USA).

Sample.Title: RNA-Seq polyA+ Blood PBMC; M00734-1

Channel.Source: Peripheral Blood Mononuclear Primary Cells, TC014; M00734-1
Channel.Characteristics: Total RNA was extracted using Trizol from Invitrogen as per manufacturer's instuctions.

The small RNA fraction was separated by electrophoresis on a Novex 10% TBE-Urea gel and the fraction between approximately 14-30nt was excised. The excisd fraction was then eluted from gel fragements, followed by EtOH precipitation and was resuspended in 6.3ul.

3' RNA adapter ligation was set up with 6.3ul of purified 5' ligation product, 1.2ul of 10uM 3' RNA adapter, 1ul of 10x Ligation buffer, 1ul of T4 RNA Ligase (5U/ul from Ambion)), and 0.5ul of Rnase OUT (40U/ul from Invitrogen). The ligation reaction was incubated at 16oC overnight.

5' RNA adapter ligation was set up with 6.2ul of purified small RNA fraction (14-30nt), 1.3ul of 5uM 5' RNA adapter, 1ul of 10x Ligation buffer, 1ul of T4 RNA Ligase (5U/ul from Ambion), and 0.5ul of Rnase OUT (40U/ul from Invitrogen). Ligation reaction was incubated at 16oC overnight.

To 4.5ul of purified ligated RNA, 0.5ul of 100uM Small RNA RT-Primer was added and heat denatured at 70oC for 2 mins. Sample was then placed on a rack at room temperature and the following reagents were added immediately to the sample (2.0ul of 5X First Strand Buffer, 0.65ul of 10mM dNTPs (Invitrogen), 1ul of 100mM DTT (Invitrogen) and 0.5ul of RNaseOUT (40U/ul from Invitrogen). Reaction was heated at 48oC for 3mins. 1.0ul of Superscript II RT (200U/ul from Invitrogen) was added to the reaction and was incubated at 44oC for 1 hr. After 1hr of incubation, tube was placed on ice. 12ul of DEPC water was added to the first strand cDNA product to make a final total volume of approximately 20ul.
10ul of the first strand cDNA product was used in the PCR
98C 30 sec, 10 cycle of 98C 10 sec, 65C 30 sec, 72C 30 sec, then 72C 5 min, 4C hold
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Library construction protocol: NA

3' RNA adapter ligation was set up with 6.3ul of purified 5' ligation product, 1.2ul of 10uM 3' RNA adapter, 1ul of 10x Ligation buffer, 1ul of T4 RNA Ligase (5U/ul from Ambion)), and 0.5ul of Rnase OUT (40U/ul from Invitrogen). The ligation reaction was incubated at 16oC overnight.

Sample.Title: RNA-Seq polyA+ Blood PBMC; A01025-1

Channel.Source: Peripheral Blood Mononuclear Primary Cells, TC014; A01025-1
Channel.Characteristics: 98C 30 sec, 10 cycle of 98C 10 sec, 65C 30 sec, 72C 30 sec, then 72C 5 min, 4C hold
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Library construction protocol: PolyA+ RNA was purified using the MACS mRNA isolation kit (Miltenyi Biotec, Bergisch Gladbach, Germany), from 2-10ug of DNaseI-treated total RNA as per the manufacturer's instructions. Double-stranded cDNA was synthesized from the purified polyA+ RNA using the Superscript Double-Stranded cDNA Synthesis kit (Invitrogen, Carlsbad, CA, USA) and random hexamer primers (Invitrogen) at a concentration of 5M. The cDNA was fragmented by sonication and a paired-end sequencing library prepared following the BCCAGSC Indexed plate based library construction standard operating procedure for the Illumina GA platform.

Sample.Title: RNA-Seq polyA+ Breast Luminal Epithelial Cell; A01029-1

Channel.Source: Breast, Luminal Epithelial Cells, RM080; A01029-1
Channel.Characteristics: 98C 30 sec, 10 cycle of 98C 10 sec, 65C 30 sec, 72C 30 sec, then 72C 5 min, 4C hold
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Library construction protocol: PolyA+ RNA was purified using the MACS mRNA isolation kit (Miltenyi Biotec, Bergisch Gladbach, Germany), from 2-10ug of DNaseI-treated total RNA as per the manufacturer's instructions. Double-stranded cDNA was synthesized from the purified polyA+ RNA using the Superscript Double-Stranded cDNA Synthesis kit (Invitrogen, Carlsbad, CA, USA) and random hexamer primers (Invitrogen) at a concentration of 5M. The cDNA was fragmented by sonication and a paired-end sequencing library prepared following the BCCAGSC Indexed plate based library construction standard operating procedure for the Illumina GA platform.

Sample.Title: RNA-Seq polyA+ Brain-Neurospheres; A03473-1

Channel.Source: Neurosphere Cultured Cells, Cortex Derived, HuFNSC01; A03473-1
Channel.Characteristics: 98C 30 sec, 10 cycle of 98C 10 sec, 65C 30 sec, 72C 30 sec, then 72C 5 min, 4C hold
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Library construction protocol: PolyA+ RNA was purified using the MACS mRNA isolation kit (Miltenyi Biotec, Bergisch Gladbach, Germany), from 2-10ug of total RNA as per the manufacturer's instructions. The process included on-column DNaseI treatment (Invitrogen, Carlsbad, CA, USA). Double stranded cDNA was synthesized from the purified polyA+ RNA using the Superscript II Double-Stranded cDNA Synthesis kit (Invitrogen) and 200ng random hexamers (Invitrogen). After first strand synthesis, dNTPs were removed using 2 volumes of AMPure XP beads (Beckman Genomics, Danvers, MA, USA). GeneAmp (Invitrogen)12.5mM dNTPs blend (2.5mM dCTP, 2.5mM dGTP, 2.5mM dATP, 5.0mM dUTP) was used in the second strand synthesis mixture. Double stranded cDNA was purified using 2 volumes of Ampure XP beads, fragmented using Covaris E series shearing (20% duty cycle, Intensity 5, 55 seconds), and used for paired-end sequencing library preparation following the BCCAGSC Indexed plate based library construction standard operating procedure for the Illumina GA/HiSeq platform with the following modifications: prior to library amplification uridine digestion was performed at 37 degrees Celsius for 30 min following with 10 min at 95 degrees Celsius in Qiagen Elution buffer (10mM Tris-Cl, pH 8.5) with 5 units of Uracil-N-Glycosylase (UNG: AmpErase).

Sample.Description: Design description: RNA-Seq polyA+ Brain-Neurospheres Library name: A03473 EDACC Genboree Experiment Page: http://genboree.org/java-bin/project.jsp?projectName=XML%20Submissions%2FUCSF-UBC%2FEXPERIMENT%2FEDACC.7581 EDACC Genboree Sample Page: http://genboree.org/java-bin/project.jsp?projectName=XML%20Submissions%2FUCSF-UBC%2FSAMPLE%2FEDACC.5486 **************** For data usage terms and conditions, please refer to: http://www.drugabuse.gov/funding/funding-opportunities/nih-common-fund/epigenomics-data-access-policies ****************

Sample.Title: RNA-Seq polyA+ Brain; A03484-1

Channel.Source: Fetal Brain, HuFNSC01; A03484-1
Channel.Characteristics: 98C 30 sec, 10 cycle of 98C 10 sec, 65C 30 sec, 72C 30 sec, then 72C 5 min, 4C hold
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Library construction protocol: PolyA+ RNA was purified using the MACS mRNA isolation kit (Miltenyi Biotec, Bergisch Gladbach, Germany), from 2-10ug of total RNA as per the manufacturer's instructions. The process included on-column DNaseI treatment (Invitrogen, Carlsbad, CA, USA). Double stranded cDNA was synthesized from the purified polyA+ RNA using the Superscript II Double-Stranded cDNA Synthesis kit (Invitrogen) and 200ng random hexamers (Invitrogen). After first strand synthesis, dNTPs were removed using 2 volumes of AMPure XP beads (Beckman Genomics, Danvers, MA, USA). GeneAmp (Invitrogen)12.5mM dNTPs blend (2.5mM dCTP, 2.5mM dGTP, 2.5mM dATP, 5.0mM dUTP) was used in the second strand synthesis mixture. Double stranded cDNA was purified using 2 volumes of Ampure XP beads, fragmented using Covaris E series shearing (20% duty cycle, Intensity 5, 55 seconds), and used for paired-end sequencing library preparation following the BCCAGSC Indexed plate based library construction standard operating procedure for the Illumina GA/HiSeq platform with the following modifications: prior to library amplification uridine digestion was performed at 37 degrees Celsius for 30 min following with 10 min at 95 degrees Celsius in Qiagen Elution buffer (10mM Tris-Cl, pH 8.5) with 5 units of Uracil-N-Glycosylase (UNG: AmpErase).

Sample.Description: Design description: RNA-Seq polyA+ Brain Library name: A03484 EDACC Genboree Experiment Page: http://genboree.org/java-bin/project.jsp?projectName=XML%20Submissions%2FUCSF-UBC%2FEXPERIMENT%2FEDACC.7585 EDACC Genboree Sample Page: http://genboree.org/java-bin/project.jsp?projectName=XML%20Submissions%2FUCSF-UBC%2FSAMPLE%2FEDACC.5482 **************** For data usage terms and conditions, please refer to: http://www.drugabuse.gov/funding/funding-opportunities/nih-common-fund/epigenomics-data-access-policies ****************

Sample.Title: RNA-Seq polyA+ Brain-Neurospheres; A04599-1

Channel.Source: Neurosphere Cultured Cells, Cortex Derived, HuFNSC03; A04599-1
Channel.Characteristics: 98C 30 sec, 10 cycle of 98C 10 sec, 65C 30 sec, 72C 30 sec, then 72C 5 min, 4C hold
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Library construction protocol: PolyA+ RNA was purified using the MACS mRNA isolation kit (Miltenyi Biotec, Bergisch Gladbach, Germany), from 2-10ug of total RNA as per the manufacturer's instructions. The process included on-column DNaseI treatment (Invitrogen, Carlsbad, CA, USA). Double stranded cDNA was synthesized from the purified polyA+ RNA using the Superscript II Double-Stranded cDNA Synthesis kit (Invitrogen) and 200ng random hexamers (Invitrogen). After first strand synthesis, dNTPs were removed using 2 volumes of AMPure XP beads (Beckman Genomics, Danvers, MA, USA). GeneAmp (Invitrogen)12.5mM dNTPs blend (2.5mM dCTP, 2.5mM dGTP, 2.5mM dATP, 5.0mM dUTP) was used in the second strand synthesis mixture. Double stranded cDNA was purified using 2 volumes of Ampure XP beads, fragmented using Covaris E series shearing (20% duty cycle, Intensity 5, 55 seconds), and used for paired-end sequencing library preparation following the BCCAGSC Indexed plate based library construction standard operating procedure for the Illumina GA/HiSeq platform with the following modifications: prior to library amplification uridine digestion was performed at 37 degrees Celsius for 30 min following with 10 min at 95 degrees Celsius in Qiagen Elution buffer (10mM Tris-Cl, pH 8.5) with 5 units of Uracil-N-Glycosylase (UNG: AmpErase).

Sample.Title: smRNA-Seq Brain-Neurospheres; M01579-1

Channel.Source: Neurosphere Cultured Cells, Cortex Derived, HuFNSC02; M01579-1
Channel.Characteristics: Total RNA was extracted using Trizol from Invitrogen as per manufacturer's instuctions.

1ug of total RNA (RN=>7.0) in a 4uL volume and 2uL of 3' Adenylated Adapter was heat denatured at 70C for 2min then snap chilled on ice for 1min. Then 1uL of 10X T4 RNL2 truncated buffer, 0.8uL 100mM MgCl2, 0.2uL DEPC water, 0.5uL Rnase Out, and 1.5uL T4 RNA Ligase 2 trancated was added. Ligation incubated at 22C in a Tetrad thermocycler for 60min.

5' RNA adapter was heat denatured at 70C for 2min then snap chilled on ice. 2uL of denatured 5' RNA Adapter was added to the 3' DNA Adapter Ligation reaction product from previous step and mixed. Then 1uL of 10mM ATP and 1uL of Ambion T4 RNA Ligase were added and ligation reaction was incubated at 37C in a Tetrad thermocycler for 60min.

To the 14uL of double adaptered miRNA product from previous step 2ul of RT-Primer was added and the mixture was heat denatured at 65C for 10 mins then quenched on ice. The following reagents were added immediately to the sample (6ul of 5X First Strand Buffer, 2ul of 10mM dNTPs , 3ul of 100mM DTT, 1ul of RNaseOUT, and 2uL of SuperScript II RT. Reaction was heated at 44C in a Thetrad thermocycler for 60minutes.
15ul of the first strand cDNA product was used in the PCR
step1: 98C for 30sec, step2: 98C for 10sec, step3: 60C for 30sec, step4: 72C for 15sec. Repeat step2-4 for 15 cycles, 72C for 5min.

28uL of PCR products containing unique index sequences are pooled together and the 115bp miRNA containing fraction is isolated for each pool either manually: 12% PAGE gel 200V 6hours followed by gel elution, or robotically using Baraccuda size selection robot. Fractions are Et0H preciptated, QCed on Agilent, and submitted for indexing single end (ISE) Illumina sequencing.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Library construction protocol: LIBPR.0054 miRNA3 - Plate format miRNA Library Construction

Sample.Title: smRNA-Seq Brain-Germinal Matrix; M01576-1

Channel.Source: Brain, Germinal Matrix, HuFGM01; M01576-1
Channel.Characteristics: Total RNA was extracted using Trizol from Invitrogen as per manufacturer's instuctions.

1ug of total RNA (RN=>7.0) in a 4uL volume and 2uL of 3' Adenylated Adapter was heat denatured at 70C for 2min then snap chilled on ice for 1min. Then 1uL of 10X T4 RNL2 truncated buffer, 0.8uL 100mM MgCl2, 0.2uL DEPC water, 0.5uL Rnase Out, and 1.5uL T4 RNA Ligase 2 trancated was added. Ligation incubated at 22C in a Tetrad thermocycler for 60min.

5' RNA adapter was heat denatured at 70C for 2min then snap chilled on ice. 2uL of denatured 5' RNA Adapter was added to the 3' DNA Adapter Ligation reaction product from previous step and mixed. Then 1uL of 10mM ATP and 1uL of Ambion T4 RNA Ligase were added and ligation reaction was incubated at 37C in a Tetrad thermocycler for 60min.

To the 14uL of double adaptered miRNA product from previous step 2ul of RT-Primer was added and the mixture was heat denatured at 65C for 10 mins then quenched on ice. The following reagents were added immediately to the sample (6ul of 5X First Strand Buffer, 2ul of 10mM dNTPs , 3ul of 100mM DTT, 1ul of RNaseOUT, and 2uL of SuperScript II RT. Reaction was heated at 44C in a Thetrad thermocycler for 60minutes.
15ul of the first strand cDNA product was used in the PCR
step1: 98C for 30sec, step2: 98C for 10sec, step3: 60C for 30sec, step4: 72C for 15sec. Repeat step2-4 for 15 cycles, 72C for 5min.

28uL of PCR products containing unique index sequences are pooled together and the 115bp miRNA containing fraction is isolated for each pool either manually: 12% PAGE gel 200V 6hours followed by gel elution, or robotically using Baraccuda size selection robot. Fractions are Et0H preciptated, QCed on Agilent, and submitted for indexing single end (ISE) Illumina sequencing.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Library construction protocol: LIBPR.0054 miRNA3 - Plate format miRNA Library Construction

Sample.Title: smRNA-Seq Brain-Neurospheres; M01580-1

Channel.Source: Neurosphere Cultured Cells, Ganglionic Eminence Derived, HuFNSC02; M01580-1
Channel.Characteristics: Neurosphere Cultured Cells, Ganglionic Eminence Derived
Total RNA was extracted using Trizol from Invitrogen as per manufacturer's instuctions.

1ug of total RNA (RN=>7.0) in a 4uL volume and 2uL of 3' Adenylated Adapter was heat denatured at 70C for 2min then snap chilled on ice for 1min. Then 1uL of 10X T4 RNL2 truncated buffer, 0.8uL 100mM MgCl2, 0.2uL DEPC water, 0.5uL Rnase Out, and 1.5uL T4 RNA Ligase 2 trancated was added. Ligation incubated at 22C in a Tetrad thermocycler for 60min.

5' RNA adapter was heat denatured at 70C for 2min then snap chilled on ice. 2uL of denatured 5' RNA Adapter was added to the 3' DNA Adapter Ligation reaction product from previous step and mixed. Then 1uL of 10mM ATP and 1uL of Ambion T4 RNA Ligase were added and ligation reaction was incubated at 37C in a Tetrad thermocycler for 60min.

To the 14uL of double adaptered miRNA product from previous step 2ul of RT-Primer was added and the mixture was heat denatured at 65C for 10 mins then quenched on ice. The following reagents were added immediately to the sample (6ul of 5X First Strand Buffer, 2ul of 10mM dNTPs , 3ul of 100mM DTT, 1ul of RNaseOUT, and 2uL of SuperScript II RT. Reaction was heated at 44C in a Thetrad thermocycler for 60minutes.
15ul of the first strand cDNA product was used in the PCR
step1: 98C for 30sec, step2: 98C for 10sec, step3: 60C for 30sec, step4: 72C for 15sec. Repeat step2-4 for 15 cycles, 72C for 5min.

28uL of PCR products containing unique index sequences are pooled together and the 115bp miRNA containing fraction is isolated for each pool either manually: 12% PAGE gel 200V 6hours followed by gel elution, or robotically using Baraccuda size selection robot. Fractions are Et0H preciptated, QCed on Agilent, and submitted for indexing single end (ISE) Illumina sequencing.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Library construction protocol: LIBPR.0054 miRNA3 - Plate format miRNA Library Construction

Sample.Title: RNA-Seq polyA+ Fetal Brain; A07825-1

Channel.Source: Fetal Brain, HuFNSC02; A07825-1
Channel.Characteristics: 98C 30 sec, 10 cycle of 98C 10 sec, 65C 30 sec, 72C 30 sec, then 72C 5 min, 4C hold
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Library construction protocol: PolyA+ RNA was purified using the MACS mRNA isolation kit (Miltenyi Biotec, Bergisch Gladbach, Germany), from 2-10ug of total RNA as per the manufacturer's instructions. The process included on-column DNaseI treatment (Invitrogen, Carlsbad, CA, USA). Double stranded cDNA was synthesized from the purified polyA+ RNA using the Superscript II Double-Stranded cDNA Synthesis kit (Invitrogen) and 200ng random hexamers (Invitrogen). After first strand synthesis, dNTPs were removed using 2 volumes of AMPure XP beads (Beckman Genomics, Danvers, MA, USA). GeneAmp (Invitrogen)12.5mM dNTPs blend (2.5mM dCTP, 2.5mM dGTP, 2.5mM dATP, 5.0mM dUTP) was used in the second strand synthesis mixture. Double stranded cDNA was purified using 2 volumes of Ampure XP beads, fragmented using Covaris E series shearing (20% duty cycle, Intensity 5, 55 seconds), and used for paired-end sequencing library preparation following the BCCAGSC Indexed plate based library construction standard operating procedure for the Illumina GA/HiSeq platform with the following modifications: prior to library amplification uridine digestion was performed at 37 degrees Celsius for 30 min following with 10 min at 95 degrees Celsius in Qiagen Elution buffer (10mM Tris-Cl, pH 8.5) with 5 units of Uracil-N-Glycosylase (UNG: AmpErase).

Sample.Description: Design description: RNA-Seq polyA+ Fetal Brain Library name: A07825 EDACC Genboree Experiment Page: http://genboree.org/java-bin/project.jsp?projectName=XML%20Submissions%2FUCSF-UBC%2FEXPERIMENT%2FEDACC.10250 EDACC Genboree Sample Page: http://genboree.org/java-bin/project.jsp?projectName=XML%20Submissions%2FUCSF-UBC%2FSAMPLE%2FEDACC.5483 **************** For data usage terms and conditions, please refer to: http://www.drugabuse.gov/funding/funding-opportunities/nih-common-fund/epigenomics-data-access-policies ****************

Sample.Title: smRNA-Seq Foreskin-Melanocyte; M01583-1

Channel.Source: Penis, Foreskin, Melanocyte Primary Cells skin01; M01583-1
Channel.Characteristics: Total RNA was extracted using Trizol from Invitrogen as per manufacturer's instuctions.

1ug of total RNA (RN=>7.0) in a 4uL volume and 2uL of 3' Adenylated Adapter was heat denatured at 70C for 2min then snap chilled on ice for 1min. Then 1uL of 10X T4 RNL2 truncated buffer, 0.8uL 100mM MgCl2, 0.2uL DEPC water, 0.5uL Rnase Out, and 1.5uL T4 RNA Ligase 2 trancated was added. Ligation incubated at 22C in a Tetrad thermocycler for 60min.

5' RNA adapter was heat denatured at 70C for 2min then snap chilled on ice. 2uL of denatured 5' RNA Adapter was added to the 3' DNA Adapter Ligation reaction product from previous step and mixed. Then 1uL of 10mM ATP and 1uL of Ambion T4 RNA Ligase were added and ligation reaction was incubated at 37C in a Tetrad thermocycler for 60min.

To the 14uL of double adaptered miRNA product from previous step 2ul of RT-Primer was added and the mixture was heat denatured at 65C for 10 mins then quenched on ice. The following reagents were added immediately to the sample (6ul of 5X First Strand Buffer, 2ul of 10mM dNTPs , 3ul of 100mM DTT, 1ul of RNaseOUT, and 2uL of SuperScript II RT. Reaction was heated at 44C in a Thetrad thermocycler for 60minutes.
15ul of the first strand cDNA product was used in the PCR
step1: 98C for 30sec, step2: 98C for 10sec, step3: 60C for 30sec, step4: 72C for 15sec. Repeat step2-4 for 15 cycles, 72C for 5min.

28uL of PCR products containing unique index sequences are pooled together and the 115bp miRNA containing fraction is isolated for each pool either manually: 12% PAGE gel 200V 6hours followed by gel elution, or robotically using Baraccuda size selection robot. Fractions are Et0H preciptated, QCed on Agilent, and submitted for indexing single end (ISE) Illumina sequencing.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Library construction protocol: LIBPR.0054 miRNA3 - Plate format miRNA Library Construction

Sample.Title: RNA-Seq (polyA+) Foreskin-Melanocyte; A07119-1

Channel.Source: Penis, Foreskin, Melanocyte Primary Cells skin02; A07119-1
Channel.Characteristics: 98C 30 sec, 10 cycle of 98C 10 sec, 65C 30 sec, 72C 30 sec, then 72C 5 min, 4C hold
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Library construction protocol: PolyA+ RNA was purified using the MACS mRNA isolation kit (Miltenyi Biotec, Bergisch Gladbach, Germany), from 2-10ug of total RNA as per the manufacturer's instructions. The process included on-column DNaseI treatment (Invitrogen, Carlsbad, CA, USA). Double stranded cDNA was synthesized from the purified polyA+ RNA using the Superscript II Double-Stranded cDNA Synthesis kit (Invitrogen) and 200ng random hexamers (Invitrogen). After first strand synthesis, dNTPs were removed using 2 volumes of AMPure XP beads (Beckman Genomics, Danvers, MA, USA). GeneAmp (Invitrogen)12.5mM dNTPs blend (2.5mM dCTP, 2.5mM dGTP, 2.5mM dATP, 5.0mM dUTP) was used in the second strand synthesis mixture. Double stranded cDNA was purified using 2 volumes of Ampure XP beads, fragmented using Covaris E series shearing (20% duty cycle, Intensity 5, 55 seconds), and used for paired-end sequencing library preparation following the BCCAGSC Indexed plate based library construction standard operating procedure for the Illumina GA/HiSeq platform with the following modifications: 1) 2ug of ActinomycinD was added during first strand cDNA synthesis; 2) prior to library amplification uridine digestion was performed at 37 degrees Celsius for 30 min following with 10 min at 95 degrees Celsius in Qiagen Elution buffer (10mM Tris-Cl, pH 8.5) with 5 units of Uracil-N-Glycosylase (UNG: AmpErase).

Sample.Description: Design description: RNA-Seq (polyA+) Foreskin-Melanocyte Library name: A07119 EDACC Genboree Experiment Page: http://genboree.org/java-bin/project.jsp?projectName=XML%20Submissions%2FUCSF-UBC%2FEXPERIMENT%2FEDACC.11202 EDACC Genboree Sample Page: http://genboree.org/java-bin/project.jsp?projectName=XML%20Submissions%2FUCSF-UBC%2FSAMPLE%2FEDACC.9575 **************** For data usage terms and conditions, please refer to: http://www.drugabuse.gov/funding/funding-opportunities/nih-common-fund/epigenomics-data-access-policies ****************

Methylation proportions were calculated as (methylated calls / (methylated calls + unmethylated calls)) for all CpGs covered by at least 4 reads. ANALYSIS FILE NAME: GSM941747_UCSF-UBC.Brain_Germinal_Matrix.Bisulfite-Seq.HuFGM02.wig ANALYSIS CENTER: EDACC ANALYSIS ALIAS: A04698-1.hg19.level.2.release.8 ANALYSIS TITLE: Methylation Proportion Graphs of Brain Germinal Matrix Bisulfite-Seq Data ANALYSIS DESCRIPTION: Illumina Bisulfite-Seq read mappings from Brain Germinal Matrix, Donor HuFGM02 were processed into graphs of methylation proportions. Methylation proportions were calculated as (methylated calls / (methylated calls + unmethylated calls)) for all CpGs covered by at least 4 reads. Reads from the + and - strands were combined for methylation proportion calculations. Sample.Title: RNA-Seq (polyA+) analysis of Neurospheres, Ganglionic Eminence Derived HuFNSC04; A15299-1

Channel.Source: Neurosphere Cultured Cells, Ganglionic Eminence Derived, HuFNSC04; A15299-1
Channel.Characteristics: Neurosphere Cultured Cells, Ganglionic Eminence Derived
98C 30 sec, 10 cycle of 98C 10 sec, 65C 30 sec, 72C 30 sec, then 72C 5 min, 4C hold
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Library construction protocol: PolyA+ RNA was purified using the MACS mRNA isolation kit (Miltenyi Biotec, Bergisch Gladbach, Germany), from 2-10ug of total RNA as per the manufacturer's instructions. The process included on-column DNaseI treatment (Invitrogen, Carlsbad, CA, USA). Double stranded cDNA was synthesized from the purified polyA+ RNA using the Superscript II Double-Stranded cDNA Synthesis kit (Invitrogen) and 200ng random hexamers (Invitrogen). After first strand synthesis, dNTPs were removed using 2 volumes of AMPure XP beads (Beckman Genomics, Danvers, MA, USA). GeneAmp (Invitrogen)12.5mM dNTPs blend (2.5mM dCTP, 2.5mM dGTP, 2.5mM dATP, 5.0mM dUTP) was used in the second strand synthesis mixture. Double stranded cDNA was purified using 2 volumes of Ampure XP beads, fragmented using Covaris E series shearing (20% duty cycle, Intensity 5, 55 seconds), and used for paired-end sequencing library preparation following the BCCAGSC Indexed plate based library construction standard operating procedure for the Illumina GA/HiSeq platform with the following modifications: 1) 2ug of ActinomycinD was added during first strand cDNA synthesis; 2) prior to library amplification uridine digestion was performed at 37 degrees Celsius for 30 min following with 10 min at 95 degrees Celsius in Qiagen Elution buffer (10mM Tris-Cl, pH 8.5) with 5 units of Uracil-N-Glycosylase (UNG: AmpErase).

Sample.Description: Design description: RNA-Seq (polyA+) analysis of Neurospheres, Ganglionic Eminence Derived HuFNSC04 using Illumina HiSeq 2000 Library name: A15299 EDACC Genboree Experiment Page: http://genboree.org/java-bin/project.jsp?projectName=XML%20Submissions%2FUCSF-UBC%2FEXPERIMENT%2FEDACC.13068 EDACC Genboree Sample Page: http://genboree.org/java-bin/project.jsp?projectName=XML%20Submissions%2FUCSF-UBC%2FSAMPLE%2FEDACC.13019 **************** For data usage terms and conditions, please refer to: http://www.drugabuse.gov/funding/funding-opportunities/nih-common-fund/epigenomics-data-access-policies ****************

Sample.Title: RNA-Seq (polyA+) analysis of UCSF-4* Cell Line hESC; A11832-1

Channel.Source: UCSF-4* Cell Line, UCSF-4* hESC; A11832-1
Channel.Characteristics: 98C 30 sec, 10 cycle of 98C 10 sec, 65C 30 sec, 72C 30 sec, then 72C 5 min, 4C hold
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Library construction protocol: PolyA+ RNA was purified using the MACS mRNA isolation kit (Miltenyi Biotec, Bergisch Gladbach, Germany), from 2-10ug of total RNA as per the manufacturer's instructions. The process included on-column DNaseI treatment (Invitrogen, Carlsbad, CA, USA). Double stranded cDNA was synthesized from the purified polyA+ RNA using the Superscript II Double-Stranded cDNA Synthesis kit (Invitrogen) and 200ng random hexamers (Invitrogen). After first strand synthesis, dNTPs were removed using 2 volumes of AMPure XP beads (Beckman Genomics, Danvers, MA, USA). GeneAmp (Invitrogen)12.5mM dNTPs blend (2.5mM dCTP, 2.5mM dGTP, 2.5mM dATP, 5.0mM dUTP) was used in the second strand synthesis mixture. Double stranded cDNA was purified using 2 volumes of Ampure XP beads, fragmented using Covaris E series shearing (20% duty cycle, Intensity 5, 55 seconds), and used for paired-end sequencing library preparation following the BCCAGSC Indexed plate based library construction standard operating procedure for the Illumina GA/HiSeq platform with the following modifications: 1) 2ug of ActinomycinD was added during first strand cDNA synthesis; 2) prior to library amplification uridine digestion was performed at 37 degrees Celsius for 30 min following with 10 min at 95 degrees Celsius in Qiagen Elution buffer (10mM Tris-Cl, pH 8.5) with 5 units of Uracil-N-Glycosylase (UNG: AmpErase).

Sample.Description: Design description: RNA-Seq (polyA+) analysis of UCSF-4* Cell Line hESC using Illumina HiSeq 2000 Library name: A11832 EDACC Genboree Experiment Page: http://genboree.org/java-bin/project.jsp?projectName=XML%20Submissions%2FUCSF-UBC%2FEXPERIMENT%2FEDACC.13071 EDACC Genboree Sample Page: http://genboree.org/java-bin/project.jsp?projectName=XML%20Submissions%2FUCSF-UBC%2FSAMPLE%2FEDACC.12720 **************** For data usage terms and conditions, please refer to: http://www.drugabuse.gov/funding/funding-opportunities/nih-common-fund/epigenomics-data-access-policies ****************

Series.Title: UCSF-UBC Human Reference Epigenome Mapping Project
Series.Summary:
The epigenome is the dynamic interface between our changing environment and the static genome, and understanding it is a goal of immense importance to human health. We will map reference cell epigenomes of the brain, breast, blood and approved embryonic stem cells, inclusive of males and females and different racial groups. This cooperative work will transform our understanding of the short and long-lasting consequences of environment impact on human health and disease.
We are working cooperatively with other Mapping Centers and the Data Coordination Center (EDACC) to comprehensively map epigenomes of select human cells with significant relevance to complex human disease. Our group, consisting of scientists at UCSF, UC Davis, UCSC and the British Columbia Genome Sciences Centre will focus on cells relevant to human health and complex disease including cells from the blood, brain, breast and U.S. Government-approved lines of human embryonic stem cells. We will incorporate high quality, homogeneous cells from males and females, and two predominant racial groups, and biological replicates of each cell type. Production of comprehensive maps will include 6 histone modifications selected for their opposing roles in regulating active and inactive chromatin, DNA methylation and miRNA and gene expression. This epigenetic data, along with genetic and expression data will be integrated using advanced informatics to address fundamental roles of epigenetics in differentiation, maintenance of cell-type identity and gene expression. Our cell and data production pipeline will incorporate verification and data validation with independent methods, and will operate under a model motivated by increased data production and decrease cost. We summarize the analysis capacity of our instruments and our explicit strategy for data sharing of our proposed REMC-generated resources including biological specimens, protocols, data, software tools and intellectual resources. We envision that our group in conjunction with the other REMC teams, the EDACC, ENCODE, future EHHD (Epigenetics of Human Health and Disease) centers and the NIH Roadmap program will develop methods, tools and reference epigenome maps for the research community that will make the promise of epigenetics in understand and treating human complex disease a reality. Our reference epigenomes will enable new disciplines including human population epigenetics, comparative epigenomics, neuroepigenetics, and therapeutic epigenetics for tissue regeneration and reversal of disease.
